item.title: Scripted modification of vRA reservations with powerVRA.
item.description: Recently, a customer of mine needed to modify a large number of vRA reservations to facilitate a migration, and because there’s nothing wrong with being lazy, using powershell is always one of my go-to options.

item.title: Setting up a powershell development environment for non-programmers
item.description: In most of my projects, powershell and its vendor-specific modules such as VMware’s powercli is usually a necessity to work effectively. In addition, most customers appreciate it greatly if you can leave them with a handful of examples on how to run standard procedures through a script, even though it might not always be part of the deliverables.
